description.zh-cn: 中国社会活动家及政治犯，因在西单民主墙发表大字报批评邓小平独裁而长期入狱，后流亡美国。
description.en: A Chinese social activist and political prisoner, imprisoned for a long time for criticizing Deng Xiaoping's dictatorship on the Xidan Democracy Wall, and later exiled to the United States.

description.zh-cn: 魏京生之父，曾在中国人民解放军总后勤部任职。
description.en: Father of Wei Jingsheng, who served in the General Logistics Department of the People's Liberation Army.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的首都，魏京生的出生地。
description.en: The capital of the People's Republic of China and the birthplace of Wei Jingsheng.

description.zh-cn: 1978年至1979年间，在北京西单墙上张贴大字报、宣传不同政见的民主运动。魏京生是其中的重要成员。
description.en: A democratic movement from 1978 to 1979 where big-character posters advocating different political views were posted on the Xidan Wall in Beijing. Wei Jingsheng was a key member.

zh-cn: 第五个现代化：民主及其他

description.zh-cn: 魏京生于1978年12月5日在西单民主墙张贴的大字报，宣扬民主主义，认为政治民主化是中国现代化的前提。
description.en: A big-character poster written by Wei Jingsheng and posted on the Xidan Democracy Wall on December 5, 1978, advocating for democracy and arguing that political democratization is a prerequisite for China's modernization.

nodes.id: 要民主还是要新的独裁

zh-cn: 要民主还是要新的独裁

description.zh-cn: 魏京生于1979年3月25日在西单民主墙张贴的大字报，直接批评邓小平走的是独裁路线。
description.en: A big-character poster written by Wei Jingsheng and posted on the Xidan Democracy Wall on March 25, 1979, directly criticizing Deng Xiaoping for taking a dictatorial path.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国第二代主要领导人，被魏京生批评为独裁者。
description.en: The paramount leader of the People's Republic of China from 1978 to 1989, criticized by Wei Jingsheng as a dictator.

description.zh-cn: 位于东亚的社会主义国家，由中国共产党领导。
description.en: A socialist state in East Asia led by the Chinese Communist Party.

nodes.id: 中华人民共和国民主运动

zh-cn: 中华人民共和国民主运动

description.zh-cn: 一系列旨在推动中华人民共和国政治民主化的社会运动，魏京生是其中的代表人物之一。
description.en: A series of social movements aimed at promoting political democratization in the People's Republic of China, of which Wei Jingsheng is a representative figure.

description.zh-cn: 瑞典的年度奖项，旨在表彰在人权领域做出杰出贡献的个人或组织。
description.en: An annual Swedish prize awarded for outstanding achievement in the field of human rights.

en: Robert F. Kennedy Human Rights Award

description.zh-cn: 由罗伯特·肯尼迪人权组织颁发，旨在表彰为人权事业做出贡献的个人。
description.en: Awarded by the Robert F. Kennedy Human Rights organization to individuals who have shown courage and made a significant contribution to human rights.

description.zh-cn: 由欧洲议会颁发的人权奖项，以苏联科学家和持不同政见者安德烈·萨哈罗夫的名字命名。
description.en: A human rights prize awarded by the European Parliament, named after Soviet scientist and dissident Andrei Sakharov.

description.zh-cn: 美国的一个非营利组织，旨在促进全球民主。
description.en: A U.S. non-profit organization aimed at promoting democracy worldwide.

description.zh-cn: 八九民运学生领袖，称呼魏京生为“民主斗士”。
description.en: A student leader in the 1989 Tiananmen Square protests, who called Wei Jingsheng a 'democracy fighter'.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国前总统，称魏京生为“民主先锋”。
description.en: Former President of the Republic of China, who called Wei Jingsheng a 'pioneer of democracy'.

nodes.id: 中国人民解放军总后勤部

zh-cn: 中国人民解放军总后勤部

description.zh-cn: 中国人民解放军的后勤保障机构，魏京生之父魏梓林曾在此任职。
description.en: The logistics support organization of the People's Liberation Army, where Wei Jingsheng's father, Wei Zilin, once served.

nodes.id: 中国人民大学附属中学

zh-cn: 中国人民大学附属中学

description.zh-cn: 位于北京的一所中学，魏京生曾在此就读。
description.en: A middle school in Beijing where Wei Jingsheng studied.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的一场政治运动，魏京生在运动初期曾参加红卫兵。
description.en: A political movement in the People's Republic of China, during which Wei Jingsheng participated in the Red Guards in its early stages.

nodes.id: 首都中学红卫兵联合行动委员会

zh-cn: 首都中学红卫兵联合行动委员会

description.zh-cn: 文化大革命初期北京的一个红卫兵组织，魏京生是其成员之一。
description.en: A Red Guard organization in Beijing during the early stages of the Cultural Revolution, of which Wei Jingsheng was a member.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东的妻子，四人帮成员之一，魏京生在文革期间开始对其产生怀疑。
description.en: Mao Zedong's wife and a member of the Gang of Four, of whom Wei Jingsheng became suspicious during the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的缔造者和第一代最高领导人，魏京生因大跃进的后果而认为其是“刽子手”。
description.en: The founder and first paramount leader of the People's Republic of China, whom Wei Jingsheng considered a 'butcher' due to the consequences of the Great Leap Forward.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的一场经济和社会运动，导致了大饥荒。魏京生目睹其后果后，对毛泽东产生了极其负面的看法。
description.en: An economic and social campaign in the People's Republic of China that resulted in a great famine. After witnessing its consequences, Wei Jingsheng developed an extremely negative view of Mao Zedong.

description.zh-cn: 魏京生在1973年退伍后被分配工作的单位，担任电工。
description.en: The workplace where Wei Jingsheng was assigned to work as an electrician after being discharged from the army in 1973.

description.zh-cn: 由魏京生等人创办的民运杂志。
description.en: A pro-democracy magazine founded by Wei Jingsheng and others.

description.zh-cn: 魏京生的朋友，曾帮助偷录魏京生在法庭上的陈词。
description.en: A friend of Wei Jingsheng who helped secretly record Wei's court statement.

description.zh-cn: 关于西藏政治地位的争议，魏京生曾于1992年致信邓小平阐述自己对此问题的看法。
description.en: The political dispute over the status of Tibet. Wei Jingsheng wrote a letter to Deng Xiaoping in 1992 explaining his views on the issue.

description.zh-cn: 美国国务院官员，曾任主管民主、人权和劳工事务的助理国务卿，于1994年2月在北京与魏京生会面。
description.en: A U.S. State Department official who served as Assistant Secretary of State for Democracy, Human Rights, and Labor, and met with Wei Jingsheng in Beijing in February 1994.

nodes.id: 北京市第一中级人民法院

zh-cn: 北京市第一中级人民法院

description.zh-cn: 审理魏京生案并于1995年以“阴谋颠覆政府罪”判处其有期徒刑14年的法院。
description.en: The court that tried Wei Jingsheng's case and sentenced him to 14 years in prison for 'conspiring to subvert the government' in 1995.

description.zh-cn: 欧洲联盟的立法机构，于1996年授予魏京生萨哈罗夫奖。
description.en: The legislative body of the European Union, which awarded the Sakharov Prize to Wei Jingsheng in 1996.

description.zh-cn: 美国第42任总统，在其1998年访华前，中国政府将魏京生流放到美国。
description.en: The 42nd President of the United States. Before his visit to China in 1998, the Chinese government exiled Wei Jingsheng to the U.S.

description.zh-cn: 美国的一所大学，在魏京生流亡美国后曾向其提供支持，后于2001年中止。
description.en: A university in the United States that provided support to Wei Jingsheng after his exile to the U.S., which was terminated in 2001.

nodes.id: 中国民主运动海外联席会议

zh-cn: 中国民主运动海外联席会议

description.zh-cn: 一个海外的中国民运组织，魏京生于1998年被推举为该组织主席。
description.en: An overseas Chinese democracy movement organization, for which Wei Jingsheng was elected chairman in 1998.

description.zh-cn: 台湾政治人物，曾任民主进步党主席，2001年与访问台湾的魏京生会晤。
description.en: A Taiwanese politician and former chairman of the Democratic Progressive Party, who met with Wei Jingsheng during his visit to Taiwan in 2001.

description.zh-cn: 美国第43任总统，曾在2008年于白宫会见魏京生等五名中国异议人士。
description.en: The 43rd President of the United States, who met with Wei Jingsheng and four other Chinese dissidents at the White House in 2008.

description.zh-cn: 中国人权活动家，曾与魏京生一同被美国总统乔治·沃克·布什会见。
description.en: A Chinese human rights activist, who was met by U.S. President George W. Bush along with Wei Jingsheng.

description.zh-cn: 维吾尔族人权活动家，曾与魏京生一同被美国总统乔治·沃克·布什会见。
description.en: A Uyghur human rights activist, who was met by U.S. President George W. Bush along with Wei Jingsheng.

description.zh-cn: 中国学者和活动家，曾与魏京生一同被美国总统乔治·沃克·布什会见。
description.en: A Chinese scholar and activist, who was met by U.S. President George W. Bush along with Wei Jingsheng.

description.zh-cn: 美籍华人牧师，曾与魏京生一同被美国总统乔治·沃克·布什会见。
description.en: A Chinese American pastor, who was met by U.S. President George W. Bush along with Wei Jingsheng.

description.zh-cn: 缅甸政治家，1990年萨哈罗夫奖获得者。魏京生曾于2009年呼吁缅甸当局将其释放。
description.en: A Burmese politician and recipient of the 1990 Sakharov Prize. Wei Jingsheng called for her release by the Myanmar authorities in 2009.

description.zh-cn: 美国政治家，曾任众议院议长。魏京生曾在其2009年访华前与其会面，并于2023年向其颁发人权奖项。
description.en: An American politician and former Speaker of the House of Representatives. Wei Jingsheng met with her before her 2009 visit to China and presented her with a human rights award in 2023.

description.zh-cn: 中国作家、人权活动家，2010年诺贝尔和平奖得主。魏京生曾批评诺贝尔奖授予他的决定。
description.en: A Chinese writer, human rights activist, and the 2010 Nobel Peace Prize laureate. Wei Jingsheng criticized the decision to award him the Nobel Prize.

description.zh-cn: 美国政治家，曾任国务卿。在其2020年题为《共产中国与自由世界的未来》的演讲中提及魏京生。
description.en: An American politician and former Secretary of State. He mentioned Wei Jingsheng in his 2020 speech titled 'Communist China and the Free World's Future'.

nodes.id: 共产中国与自由世界的未来

zh-cn: 共产中国与自由世界的未来
en: Communist China and the Free World's Future

description.zh-cn: 美国国务卿迈克·蓬佩奥于2020年7月23日发表的演讲，其中提及了魏京生和王丹。
description.en: A speech delivered by U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo on July 23, 2020, in which he mentioned Wei Jingsheng and Wang Dan.

description.zh-cn: 于2019年在美国起诉魏京生人身伤害。
description.en: Sued Wei Jingsheng in the U.S. for personal injury in 2019.

description.zh-cn: 魏京生基金会执行主任，被刘怀昭一同起诉。
description.en: Executive Director of the Wei Jingsheng Foundation, who was also sued by Liu Huaizhao.

description.zh-cn: 由魏京生在美国创立的组织，旨在推动中国的民主和人权。
description.en: An organization founded by Wei Jingsheng in the United States to promote democracy and human rights in China.

description.zh-cn: 政治评论员，曾撰文高度评价魏京生。
description.en: A political commentator who wrote an article highly praising Wei Jingsheng.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的国家通讯社，曾在1979年发表文章批判魏京生。
description.en: The state news agency of the People's Republic of China, which published an article criticizing Wei Jingsheng in 1979.

description.zh-cn: 2022年开始的军事冲突，魏京生曾对此发表观点，赞同俄罗斯方面的部分说法。
description.en: A military conflict that began in 2022. Wei Jingsheng expressed his views on it, agreeing with some of Russia's justifications.

description.zh-cn: 俄罗斯总统，发动了对乌克兰的入侵。魏京生赞同其“为保护本民族不再遭受种族清洗”的说法。
description.en: President of Russia who launched the invasion of Ukraine. Wei Jingsheng agreed with his justification of 'protecting his people from ethnic cleansing'.

relationships.target: 中华人民共和国民主运动

description.zh-cn: 魏京生是中国民主运动中的重要人物，被誉为“中国民运之父”。
description.en: Wei Jingsheng is a key figure in the Chinese democracy movement and is known as the 'Father of the Chinese Democracy Movement'.

description.zh-cn: 撰写并发表了《第五个现代化：民主及其他》。
description.en: Authored and published 'The Fifth Modernization: Democracy and Others'.

relationships.target: 要民主还是要新的独裁

description.zh-cn: 撰写并发表了《要民主还是要新的独裁》。
description.en: Authored and published 'Do We Want Democracy or New Dictatorship?'.

description.zh-cn: 在《要民主还是要新的独裁》中批评邓小平是“独裁者”。
description.en: Criticized Deng Xiaoping as a 'dictator' in 'Do We Want Democracy or New Dictatorship?'.

description.zh-cn: 因“反革命罪”和“阴谋颠覆政府罪”两次被判刑，累计服刑超过十八年。
description.en: Was twice sentenced to prison for 'counter-revolutionary crimes' and 'conspiring to subvert the government', serving a total of over 18 years.

description.zh-cn: 授予魏京生1994年奥洛夫·帕尔梅纪念奖以表彰其在人权领域的贡献。
description.en: Awarded the 1994 Olof Palme Prize to Wei Jingsheng in recognition of his contributions to human rights.

description.zh-cn: 授予魏京生1994年罗伯特·肯尼迪人权奖。
description.en: Awarded the 1994 Robert F. Kennedy Human Rights Award to Wei Jingsheng.

description.zh-cn: 在魏京生在囚期间授予其1996年萨哈罗夫奖。
description.en: Awarded the 1996 Sakharov Prize to Wei Jingsheng while he was imprisoned.

description.zh-cn: 授予魏京生1998年民主奖。
description.en: Awarded the 1998 Democracy Award to Wei Jingsheng.

description.zh-cn: 八九民运领袖王丹称呼魏京生为“民主斗士”，两人均为海外知名民运人士。
description.en: 1989 democracy movement leader Wang Dan called Wei Jingsheng a 'democracy fighter'; both are prominent overseas democracy activists.

description.zh-cn: 时任中华民国总统马英九称赞魏京生为“民主先锋”。
description.en: Then-President of the Republic of China Ma Ying-jeou praised Wei Jingsheng as a 'pioneer of democracy'.

relationships.target: 中国人民解放军总后勤部

description.zh-cn: 魏京生之父魏梓林在中国人民解放军总后勤部任职。
description.en: Wei Jingsheng's father, Wei Zilin, served in the General Logistics Department of the People's Liberation Army.

relationships.target: 中国人民大学附属中学

description.zh-cn: 魏京生在文化大革命初期参加了红卫兵，这段经历促使他对江青等人产生了怀疑。
description.en: Wei Jingsheng joined the Red Guards in the early days of the Cultural Revolution, an experience that led him to become suspicious of Jiang Qing and others.

relationships.target: 首都中学红卫兵联合行动委员会

description.zh-cn: 在文化大革命期间，魏京生参加了属于首都中学红卫兵联合行动委员会的红卫兵组织。
description.en: During the Cultural Revolution, Wei Jingsheng joined a Red Guard group that was part of the United Action Committee of Capital Red Guards.

description.zh-cn: 在文革串联期间，魏京生开始对江青等人产生怀疑，形成反对立场。
description.en: During the networking phase of the Cultural Revolution, Wei Jingsheng began to harbor suspicions about Jiang Qing and others, forming an oppositional stance.

description.zh-cn: 在安徽金寨看到大跃进饿死人的废墟后，魏京生认为毛泽东是“刽子手”。
description.en: After seeing the ruins left by the Great Leap Forward famine in Jinzhai, Anhui, Wei Jingsheng came to believe that Mao Zedong was a 'butcher'.

description.zh-cn: 目睹大跃进造成的惨状，是促使魏京生形成反毛泽东思想的关键事件。
description.en: Witnessing the devastation caused by the Great Leap Forward was a key event that led Wei Jingsheng to form his anti-Mao Zedong views.

description.zh-cn: 魏京生是西单民主墙运动的重要成员，在此张贴了《第五个现代化》等著名大字报。
description.en: Wei Jingsheng was a key member of the Xidan Democracy Wall movement, where he posted famous big-character posters such as 'The Fifth Modernization'.

description.zh-cn: 作为魏京生的朋友，刘青在1979年帮助偷录并发表了魏京生的法庭陈词。
description.en: As a friend of Wei Jingsheng, Liu Qing helped secretly record and publish Wei's court statement in 1979.

description.zh-cn: 在狱中致信邓小平，阐述自己对西藏前途的看法。
description.en: Wrote a letter to Deng Xiaoping from prison, explaining his views on the future of Tibet.

description.zh-cn: 在克林顿总统1998年访华前，作为中美“人质外交”的一部分，中国政府以“保外就医”名义将魏京生释放并流放到美国。
description.en: Prior to President Clinton's 1998 visit to China, as part of US-China 'hostage diplomacy', the Chinese government released Wei Jingsheng on 'medical parole' and exiled him to the United States.

description.zh-cn: 在魏京生流亡美国后，哥伦比亚大学为其提供了办公室、公寓等支持。
description.en: After Wei Jingsheng was exiled to the US, Columbia University provided him with support including an office and an apartment.

description.zh-cn: 于2001年6月中止了对魏京生的财务支出。
description.en: Terminated its financial support for Wei Jingsheng in June 2001.

relationships.target: 中国民主运动海外联席会议

description.zh-cn: 2001年访问台湾时与时任民主进步党前主席施明德会晤。
description.en: Met with former Democratic Progressive Party chairman Shih Ming-teh during a visit to Taiwan in 2001.

description.zh-cn: 在出席北京奥运会前，布什总统在白宫会见了包括魏京生在内的五位中国自由活动人士。
description.en: Before attending the Beijing Olympics, President Bush met with five Chinese freedom activists, including Wei Jingsheng, at the White House.

description.zh-cn: 与其他萨哈罗夫奖获得者共同呼吁缅甸当局立即释放翁山苏姬。
description.en: Joined other Sakharov Prize laureates in calling for the immediate release of Aung San Suu Kyi by the Myanmar authorities.

description.zh-cn: 在美国众议院议长南希·佩洛西2009年出访中国大陆前与其探讨过该次访问。
description.en: Discussed the upcoming visit with U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi before her 2009 trip to mainland China.

description.zh-cn: 在刘晓波获得诺贝尔和平奖后，批评该奖项授予刘晓波的决定。
description.en: After Liu Xiaobo was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize, he criticized the decision to give him the award.

description.zh-cn: 在其《共产中国与自由世界的未来》演讲中点名提及魏京生，魏京生亦出席了该演讲。
description.en: Mentioned Wei Jingsheng by name in his speech 'Communist China and the Free World's Future', which Wei also attended.

description.zh-cn: 向美国众议院荣休议长南希·佩洛西颁发“魏京生民主人权终身奖”。
description.en: Presented the 'Wei Jingsheng Democracy and Human Rights Lifetime Achievement Award' to U.S. Speaker Emerita Nancy Pelosi.

description.zh-cn: 以人身伤害为由在美国法院起诉魏京生。
description.en: Sued Wei Jingsheng in a U.S. court for personal injury.

description.zh-cn: 在其2011年《从魏京生到刘晓波》一文中高度评价魏京生。
description.en: Highly praised Wei Jingsheng in his 2011 article 'From Wei Jingsheng to Liu Xiaobo'.

description.zh-cn: 在1979年发表报道，对魏京生进行批判，并引述群众言论支持法院对魏的判决。
description.en: Published a report in 1979 criticizing Wei Jingsheng and citing public opinion in support of the court's verdict against him.

description.zh-cn: 赞同俄罗斯总统普京关于发动战争的观点，认为是“为保护本民族不再遭受种族清洗”。
description.en: Agreed with Russian President Putin's viewpoint on launching the war, considering it an act 'to protect his nation from further ethnic cleansing'.
